## The Problem States

```text
The four adjacent digits in the 1000-digit number that have the greatest product are 9 × 9 × 8 × 9 = 5832.

...

Find the thirteen adjacent digits in the 1000-digit number that have the greatest product. What is the value of this product?
```

The number can be seen [HERE](https://projecteuler.net/problem=8)

## My Solution

I decided to just copy the number in as a variable, even though it would have been neater to read it from a file.
From there it is pretty simple, I create an array of `Int` types and then go through the string and convert each
number to an `Int`.

I then start a loop that multiplied every possible occurrence and changes the `answer` if is is greater than any
previous answers.

```swift
public func problem8 () -> Int {

    let num:String = ""

    var numArray: [Int] = []
    for i in num.characters {
        numArray.append(Int(String(i))!)
    }

    var max = 0
    for i in 0..<987 {
        var product = 1;
        for j in 0..<13 {
            product *= numArray[i+j]
            if ( product > max ) {
                max = product
            }
        }
    }
    return(max)
}
```

## The Output

```text
23514624000
```
